importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The alleged cyberattack on China's National Time Service Center staff via messaging app vulnerabilities occurred in 2022.
The U.S. National Security Agency was accused of targeting internal network systems of the center from 2023 to 2024.
The attempted infiltration of a key timing system at the center was reported to have taken place during 2023–2024.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period from 2023 to 2024 includes the alleged use of 42 special cyberattack weapons and infiltration attempts on China’s timing infrastructure.

keyTakeAways: China accused the U.S. National Security Agency of cyberattacks targeting its National Time Service Center in 2022 and 2023–2024.
The attacks allegedly exploited vulnerabilities in foreign mobile phone messaging apps to steal sensitive information from staff.
The National Time Service Center is responsible for China’s standard time and critical services in communications, finance, power, transport, and defense.
China claims it has evidence but did not disclose it in the public statement.
The U.S. Embassy did not respond directly to the allegations but previously claimed China poses the most active cyber threat to U.S. interests.
The incident may escalate tensions between China and the U.S. over cyber warfare and national security issues.

summaryOfNewsArticle: China accused the U.S. National Security Agency of conducting a series of cyberattacks between 2022 and 2024 on its National Time Service Center, claiming that the attacks exploited vulnerabilities in foreign messaging apps and used 42 specialized cyber weapons to infiltrate internal systems and steal sensitive data. The National Time Service Center is critical to China’s time standards and supports vital industries including finance, power, and defense. China stated it has evidence but did not provide it publicly. The U.S. did not respond directly, but previously claimed China is the most active cyber threat to U.S. interests. The incident highlights escalating cyber tensions between the two nations, raising concerns about global digital security and strategic competition.
title: China Accuses U.S. Cyber Agency of Targeting National Time Center
